Title: Extends expiration of provisions of judiciary law authorizing referees to determine applications for orders of protection while family court is in session
Summary: Extends the chief administrator of the courts' authority to allow referees to determine certain applications to a family court for an order of protection.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend chapter 363 of the laws of 2010, amending the judiciary law relating to granting the chief administrator of the courts the authority to allow referees to determine applications for orders of protection during the hours family court is in session, in relation to the expiration thereof
